body_html:
It looks like TensorShape's __getitem__ is ok to call with no dimensions (see https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/tensor_shape.py#L507). I added a test that uses a shapeless placeholder to be sure.

Note that the extra logic here: kentonl@04036d7#diff-9d717423e6d3f4359151c45dfaa554b6R234 is required for shapeless placeholders to work correctly for bidirectional RNNs.
body_text:
It looks like TensorShape's __getitem__ is ok to call with no dimensions (see https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/tensor_shape.py#L507). I added a test that uses a shapeless placeholder to be sure.
Note that the extra logic here: kentonl@04036d7#diff-9d717423e6d3f4359151c45dfaa554b6R234 is required for shapeless placeholders to work correctly for bidirectional RNNs.
body:
It looks like TensorShape's `__getitem__` is ok to call with no dimensions (see https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/tensor_shape.py#L507). I added a test that uses a shapeless placeholder to be sure.

Note that the extra logic here: https://github.com/kentonl/tensorflow/commit/04036d7e443da373cc151305ba81ffacafe85d13#diff-9d717423e6d3f4359151c45dfaa554b6R234 is required for shapeless placeholders to work correctly for bidirectional RNNs.
